column1: Color reproduction is very accurate, and because there is no heating the scale distortion is less than ±0.1%.
column2: 它的色彩再现非常准确，而且由于没有加热，图像比例失真低于 ±0.1%。

column1: (All laser printers have an accuracy of ±1%.)
column2: (所有的激光打印机都有 ±1%的失真。)

column1: Worldwide, most survey offices used this printer before color inkjet plotters become popular.
column2: 在彩色喷墨绘图仪普及之前，世界上大多数测绘事务所都用这种打印机打印。

column1: Liquid ink electrostatic printers were mostly available in 36 to 54 inches (910 to 1,370 mm) width and also 6 color printing.
column2: 市面上的液墨静电打印机大多为 36-54 英寸（910-1370 毫米）宽，而且也支持六色打印。

column1: These were also used to print large billboards.
column2: 这些打印机还被用来打印大型广告牌。

column1: It was first introduced by Versatec, which was later bought by Xerox.
column2: 最早推出这种打印机的是 Versatec 公司，后来被 Xerox 收购。

column1: 3M also used to make these printers.
column2: 3M 公司也生产过这种打印机。

column1: Shampoo (/ʃæmˈpuː/) is a hair care product, typically in the form of a viscous liquid, that is used for cleaning hair.
column2: 洗发水 （英文叫 Shampoo，发音/ʃæmˈpuː/） 是一种头发护理产品， 通常呈粘稠液状，用于清洗头发。

column1: Less commonly, shampoo is available in bar form, like a bar of soap.
column2: 有时候，洗发水会做成条状出售，像一条肥皂那样。不过这种情况较少。

column1: Shampoo is used by applying it to wet hair, massaging the product into the hair, and then rinsing it out.
column2: 洗发水的使用方法是抹在打湿的头发上，按摩一下将其揉进头发里，然后用水冲洗干净。

column1: Some users may follow a shampooing with the use of hair conditioner.
column2: 一些人可能还会用护发素再洗一遍。

column1: The typical reason of using shampoo is to remove the unwanted build-up of sebum in the hair without stripping out so much as to make hair unmanageable.
column2: 用洗发水洗头通常是为了清除头发中积聚过多的皮脂，但又不能清除过度，以免头发难以梳理。

column1: Shampoo is generally made by combining a surfactant, most often sodium lauryl sulfate or sodium laureth sulfate, with a co-surfactant, most often cocamidopropyl betaine in water.
column2: 洗发水通常是由一种表面活性剂（一般为十二烷基硫酸钠，也称月桂醇聚醚硫酸钠）和一种助表面活性剂（一般为椰油酰胺丙基甜菜碱）在水中混合而制成。

column1: The sulphate ingredient acts as a surfactant, essentially heavy duty soap that makes it easier to trap oil and grease.
column2: 该硫酸盐成分起到表面活性剂的作用，本质上是一种结实耐用的肥皂，有助于更好地吸走油脂。

column1: Specialty shampoos are marketed to people with dandruff, color-treated hair, gluten or wheat allergies, an interest in using an organic product, and infants and young children ("baby shampoo" is less irritating).
column2: 专业洗发水的销售对象是头屑较多者、染发者、对麸质或小麦过敏者、对使用有机产品有兴趣者以及婴幼儿（“宝宝洗发水”的刺激性会小一些）。

column1: There are also shampoos intended for animals that may contain insecticides or other medications to treat skin conditions or parasite infestations such as fleas.
column2: 也有专门针对动物的洗发水，这种洗发水可能含有杀虫剂或其他药物，用于治疗皮肤问题或跳蚤等寄生虫感染。

column1: The word shampoo entered the English language from the Indian subcontinent during the colonial era.
column2: “shampoo”一词于殖民时期由印度次大陆传入英国。

column1: It dates to 1762 and is derived from Hindi chāmpo (चाँपो [tʃãːpoː]), itself derived from the Sanskrit root chapati (चपति), which means to press, knead, soothe.
column2: 这个词可追溯到 1762 年，源自印地语中的“chāmpo（चाँपो [tʃãːpoː]）”, 而这个印地语单词本身又源自梵语的词根“ chapati（चपति）”, 意为按压、揉捏、抚慰。

column1: In the Indian subcontinent, a variety of herbs and their extracts have been used as shampoos since ancient times.
column2: 在印度次大陆，各种各样的草药及其提取物自古以来就被用作洗发水。

column1: A very effective early shampoo was made by boiling Sapindus with dried Indian gooseberry (amla) and a selection of other herbs, using the strained extract.
column2: 早期有一种非常有效的洗发水是将无患子与晒干的印度猕猴桃（alma）以及其他精选的草药放在一起煮沸然后过滤提取出来的。

column1: Sapindus, also known as soapberries or soapnuts, a tropical tree widespread in India, is called ksuna (Sanskrit: क्षुण) in ancient Indian texts and its fruit pulp contains saponins which are a natural surfactant.
column2: 无患子，又称木患子、油患子，是一种广泛分布在印度的热带树木，在古印度典籍中被称为 ksuna（梵语: क्षुण），果肉含有皂苷，是一种天然的表面活性剂。

column1: The extract of soapberries creates a lather which Indian texts called phenaka (Sanskrit: फेनक).
column2: 无患子的提取物会产生一种在印度典籍中叫做“phenaka（梵语：फेनक）”的泡沫。

column1: It leaves the hair soft, shiny and manageable.
column2: 它可以使头发柔软，有光泽，易于打理。

column1: Other products used for hair cleansing were shikakai (Acacia concinna), hibiscus flowers, ritha (Sapindus mukorossi) and arappu (Albizzia amara).
column2: 其他用于头发清洁的产品还有头发果子（Acacia concinna）、洛神花、 无患子果（Sapindus mukorossi）以及合欢花（Albizzia amara）。

column1: Guru Nanak, the founder and the first Guru of Sikhism, made references to soapberry tree and soap in the 16th century.
column2: 锡克教的创教人兼锡克教第一位古鲁纳纳克在 16 世纪曾提到过无患子树和肥皂。

column1: Cleansing with hair and body massage (champu) during one's daily bath was an indulgence of early colonial traders in India.
column2: 每天沐浴时用头发和身体清洁剂（champu）来清洁是早期印度殖民地商人的一大嗜好。

column1: When they returned to Europe, they introduced the newly learned habits, including the hair treatment they called shampoo.
column2: 当他们回到欧洲，他们这一新习惯也随之被传了过来，包括头发护理法也被带回，他们称之为“香波”。

column1: Sake Dean Mahomed, an Indian traveller, surgeon, and entrepreneur, is credited with introducing the practice of champooi or "shampooing" to Britain.
column2: 米克尔·恩迪·穆罕默德是印度的一位旅行家兼外科医生兼企业家，人们认为是他把“shampooing（香波）”的做法带进了英国。

column1: In 1814, Mahomed, with his Irish wife Jane Daly, opened the first commercial "shampooing" vapour masseur bath in England, in Brighton.
column2: 1814 年，穆罕默德和他的爱尔兰妻子简·戴莉在英国布莱顿开了第一家商业“香波”蒸汽按摩洗浴店。

column1: He described the treatment in a local paper as "The Indian Medicated Vapour Bath (type of Turkish bath), a cure to many diseases and giving full relief when everything fails; particularly Rheumatic and paralytic, gout, stiff joints, old sprains, lame legs, aches and pains in the joints".
column2: 他在当地的一份报纸上将这种护理法描述为“印度药物蒸汽浴（蒸气浴是土耳其的一种沐浴法），可以治愈多种疾病，能在你到处求医无果时帮你彻底脱离苦海，特别是对于风湿病、麻痹症、痛风、关节僵硬、陈年扭伤、跛腿、各种疼痛以及和关节疼痛。”

column1: During the early stages of shampoo in Europe, English hair stylists boiled shaved soap in water and added herbs to give the hair shine and fragrance.
column2: 在洗发水被引进英国早期，英国的发型师把肥皂削成片放在水里煮沸，然后加入草药来使头发变香且有光泽。

column1: Commercially made shampoo was available from the turn of the 20th century.
column2: 20 世纪初起，市面上开始出现商业性质的洗发水。

column1: A 1914 advertisement for Canthrox Shampoo in American Magazine showed young women at camp washing their hair with Canthrox in a lake; magazine advertisements in 1914 by Rexall featured Harmony Hair Beautifier and Shampoo.
column2: 1914 年，《美国杂志》刊登了一则 Canthrox 洗发水广告，广告中年轻的女士在营地上用 Canthrox 洗发水在湖中洗头。而 1914 年 Rexall 公司在杂志上刊登的洗发水广告则主打“Hamony 系列美发洗发用品”。

column1: In 1927, liquid shampoo was invented by German inventor Hans Schwarzkopf in Berlin, whose name created a shampoo brand sold in Europe.
column2: 1927 年，德国发明家汉斯·施华蔻在柏林发明了液体洗发水，他的名字成为该款洗发水在欧洲市场销售的品牌名。

column1: Originally, soap and shampoo were very similar products; both containing the same naturally derived surfactants, a type of detergent.
column2: 一开始，肥皂和洗发水这两种产品是非常相似的，两者都含有相同的天然表面活性剂，而表面活性剂是一种洗涤剂。

column1: Modern shampoo as it is known today was first introduced in the 1930s with Drene, the first shampoo using synthetic surfactants instead of soap.
column2: 我们今天所熟悉的现代洗发水的初代是 20 世纪 30 年代推出的 Drene 洗发水，这是第一款使用合成表面活性剂代替肥皂的洗发水。

column1: Early shampoos used in Indonesia were made from the husk and straw (merang) of rice.
column2: 早期在印尼，人们使用的洗发水是由稻壳和秸秆（merang）制成的。

column1: The husks and straws were burned into ash, and the ashes (which have alkaline properties) are mixed with water to form lather.
column2: 他们把稻壳和秸秆烧成灰烬，灰烬（具有碱性）与水混合就会形成泡沫。

column1: The ashes and lather were scrubbed into the hair and rinsed out, leaving the hair clean, but very dry.
column2: 弄一些灰烬和泡沫到头发上，揉搓后用水冲洗掉，这样头发就干净了，但是非常干燥。

column1: Afterwards, coconut oil was applied to the hair in order to moisturize it.
column2: 后来，椰子油也被用于洗头，以滋润头发。

column1: Certain Native American tribes used extracts from North American plants as hair shampoo; for example the Costanoans of present-day coastal California used extracts from the coastal woodfern, Dryopteris expansa,
column2: 某些美洲土著部落以北美地区的植物提取物作为洗发液。例如，今天加利福尼亚沿海的柯斯达诺人就从沿海生长的木蕨（广布鳞毛蕨）中提取。

column1: Before quinoa can be eaten the saponin must be washed out from the grain prior to cooking.
column2: 食用藜麦前必须先洗一下，将上面的皂苷洗掉，再进行烹饪。

column1: Pre-Columbian Andean civilizations used this soapy by-product as a shampoo.
column2: 前哥伦布时代的安第斯文明将这种含肥皂的副产品用作洗发水。

column1: In the United States, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) mandates that shampoo containers accurately list ingredients on the products container.
column2: 美国食品药品监督管理局规定，在美国，洗发水必须在瓶身上准确列出所含成分。

column1: The government further regulates what shampoo manufacturers can and cannot claim as any associated benefit.
column2: 政府还进一步规定了洗发水厂商可以宣称产品具有哪些功效，不可以宣称哪些功效。

column1: Shampoo producers often use these regulations to challenge marketing claims made by competitors, helping to enforce these regulations.
column2: 洗发水生产商经常利用这些规定来挑战竞争对手的营销宣传，从而推动了这些规定的落实。

column1: While the claims may be substantiated, however, the testing methods and details of such claims are not as straightforward.
column2: 然而，虽然对营销宣传进行验证是有其可能性的，但真要验起来，用什么手段，要验证哪些细节，谈何容易。

column1: For example, many products are purported to protect hair from damage due to ultraviolet radiation.
column2: 比如，很多洗发用品都宣称能够保护头发免受紫外线辐射的伤害。

column1: While the ingredient responsible for this protection does block UV, it is not often present in a high enough concentration to be effective.
column2: 洗发水中确实存在具有抵挡紫外线功能的成分，但浓度往往不够高，不足以有效地阻挡紫外线。

column1: The North American Hair Research Society has a program to certify functional claims based on third-party testing.
column2: 北美头发研究协会就有一个基于第三方测试对功效宣传进行认证的计划。

column1: Shampoos made for treating medical conditions such as dandruff or itchy scalp are regulated as OTC drugs in the US marketplace.
column2: 用于治疗头屑或头皮瘙痒等疾病状况的洗发水在美国市场被列为非处方药。

column1: In the European Union, there is a requirement for the anti-dandruff claim to be substantiated as with any other advertising claim, but it is not considered to be a medical problem.
column2: 欧盟地区则要求，与广告中宣传的所有其他功效一样，对去屑功效的宣称也必须经过证实，但在欧盟，去头屑并不被认为是一个医学问题。

column1: A number of contact allergens are used as ingredients in shampoos, and contact allergy caused by shampoos is well known.
column2: 一些接触性过敏原被用作洗发水的成分，由洗发水引起的接触性过敏是众所周知的。

column1: Patch testing can identify ingredients to which patients are allergic, after which a physician can help the patient find a shampoo that is free of the ingredient to which they are allergic.
column2: 斑贴试验可以识别出患者对哪些成分过敏，然后医生就可以帮忙找到对该患者来说不含致敏成分的洗发水。

column1: The US bans 11 ingredients from shampoos, Canada bans 587, and the EU bans 1328.
column2: 美国规定了 11 种洗发水禁用成分，加拿大 587 种，欧盟 1328 种。

column1: Cosmetic companies have developed shampoos specifically for those who have dandruff.
column2: 化妆品公司研制了专门针对头皮屑患者的洗发水。

column1: These contain fungicides such as ketoconazole, zinc pyrithione and selenium disulfide, which reduce loose dander by killing fungi like Malassezia furfur.
column2: 这些洗发水含有酮康唑、锌吡硫酮和硒二硫化物等杀菌剂，可以通过杀死糠秕马拉色菌之类的真菌来减少已经松动的头屑。

column1: Coal tar and salicylate derivatives are often used as well.
column2: 煤焦油和水杨酸衍生品也常被用于其中。

column1: Alternatives to medicated shampoos are available for people who wish to avoid synthetic fungicides.
column2: 想要避免使用合成杀菌剂的消费者可以选择药用洗发水。

column1: Such shampoos often use tea tree oil, essential oils or herbal extracts.
column2: 这类洗发水的成分通常是茶树油、精油或草本提取物。

column1: Many companies have also developed color-protection shampoos suitable for colored hair; some of these shampoos contain gentle cleansers according to their manufacturers.
column2: 很多公司还开发了适合染发者的护色洗发水，其中一些生产商表示自己的产品含有温和的清洁成分。

column1: They have the advantage of being spill-proof.
column2: 这些洗发剂具有防溅的优点。

column1: They are easy to apply; one may simply rub the bar over wet hair, and work the soaped hair into a low lather.
column2: 这种洗头皂易于使用：在打湿的头发上用皂块擦一下，将沾有皂液的头发揉出低泡沫。

column1: Stiff, non-pourable clear gels to be squeezed from a tube were once popular forms of shampoo, and can be produced by increasing a shampoo's viscosity.
column2: 透明凝胶状的洗发水一度很流行，这种形式的洗发水很稠，倒不出来，要从管里挤出来用。这类洗发水可以通过增加洗发水的粘稠度来生产。

column1: This type of shampoo cannot be spilled, but unlike a solid, it can still be lost down the drain by sliding off wet skin or hair.
column2: 这种洗发水不会溢出来，但与固体洗发剂不同的是，它还是会顺着打湿了的肌肤或头发滑下来落到排水沟中。

column1: Shampoos in the form of pastes or creams were formerly marketed in jars or tubes.
column2: 膏状或霜状洗发剂之前是装在罐子或管子里出售的。

column1: The contents were wet but not completely dissolved.
column2: 里面装的物质虽然是湿的，但未完全溶解。

column1: They would apply faster than solids and dissolve quickly.
column2: 它用起来要比固态的快，溶解速度也很快。

column1: Antibacterial shampoos are often used in veterinary medicine for various conditions, as well as in humans before some surgical procedures.
column2: 抗菌洗发剂经常用于应对兽医上的各种疾病状况，也用在进行外科手术之前的病人身上。

column1: Closely associated with environmentalism, the "no poo" movement consists of people rejecting the societal norm of frequent shampoo use.
column2: “no poo（不用洗头水）”运动与环保主义密切相关，参加该运动的人反对频繁使用洗发水洗头，对这一约定成俗的行为进行抵制。

column1: Some adherents of the no poo movement use baking soda or vinegar to wash their hair, while others use diluted honey.
column2: 有些“no poo”倡导者改用小苏打或醋来洗头，有些用稀释的蜂蜜。

column1: Other people use nothing, rinsing their hair only with conditioner.
column2: 还有些人什么洗发剂都不用，只用护发素冲一下头发。

column1: In the 1970s, ads featuring Farrah Fawcett and Christie Brinkley asserted that it was unhealthy not to shampoo several times a week.
column2: 20 世纪 70 年代，由法拉·福西特和克里斯蒂·布林克利代言的一些广告称，一周不用几次洗发水会导致不健康。

column1: This mindset is reinforced by the greasy feeling of the scalp after a day or two of not shampooing.
column2: 的确，一两天不用洗发水，就会觉得头皮油乎乎的，于是更加强化了人们的这种思维倾向。

column1: Using shampoo every day removes sebum, the oil produced by the scalp.
column2: 每天用洗发水洗头可以去除皮脂，即头皮分泌出来的油脂。

column1: This causes the sebaceous glands to produce oil at a higher rate, to compensate for what is lost during shampooing.
column2: 这会导致皮脂腺分泌油脂的速度加快，以弥补洗头过程中失去的油脂。

column1: According to Michelle Hanjani, a dermatologist at Columbia University, a gradual reduction in shampoo use will cause the sebum glands to produce at a slower rate, resulting in less grease in the scalp.
column2: 哥伦比亚大学的皮肤科医生米歇尔·汉贾尼表示，逐渐减少洗发水的使用可以使皮脂腺分泌油脂的速度减慢，这样就可以减少头皮上的油脂。

column1: Although this approach might seem unappealing to some individuals, many people try alternate shampooing techniques like baking soda and vinegar in order to avoid ingredients used in many shampoos that make hair greasy over time.
column2: 虽然这一方法并不为一些人所待见，但很多人还是尝试着用其他方法来代替洗发水，如小苏打和醋等，因为洗发水中的成分时间一长就会致使头发变得油腻。

column1: A railway platform is an area alongside a railway track providing convenient access to trains.
column2: 铁路站台是铁路轨道旁边的区域，以方便乘客登上列车。

column1: Almost all stations have some form of platform, with larger stations having multiple platforms.
column2: 几乎所有的车站都设有某种形式的站台，较大的车站则会有多个站台。

column1: The world's longest station platform is at Gorakhpur Junction in India at 1,355.40 metres (4,446.9 ft).
column2: 世界上最长的站台位于印度戈勒克布尔，长达1,355.40 米（4,446.9 英尺）。

column1: The Appalachian Trail station in the United States, at the other extreme, has a platform which is only long enough for a single bench.
column2: 最短的站台位于美国阿巴拉契亚铁路站，长度仅够放一张长凳。

column1: Among some United States train conductors the word "platform" has entered usage as a verb meaning "to berth at a station", as in the announcement: "The last two cars of this train will not platform at East Rockaway".
column2: 在美国的一些火车票售票员口中，“站台”一词已被用作动词，意为“在车站停靠”，比如像这样的播报：“本次列车最后两节车厢不停靠东罗卡威车站。”

column1: The most basic form of platform consists of an area at the same level as the track, usually resulting in a fairly large height difference between the platform and the train floor.
column2: 站台最基本的形式是一块与铁轨高度持平的区域，这导致站台与车厢地板之间有一个很大的高度差。

column1: This would often not be considered a true platform.
column2: 这样的站台通常不算真正意义上的站台。

column1: The more traditional platform is elevated relative to the track but often lower than the train floor, although ideally they should be at the same level.
column2: 更典型的站台是高出铁轨的，但通常比车厢地板要低，尽管理想情况下站台应该和车厢地板一样高。

column1: Occasionally the platform is higher than the train floor, where a train with a low floor serves a station built for trains with a high floor, for example at the Dutch stations of the DB Regionalbahn Westfalen (see Enschede).
column2: 有些情况下，站台会比车厢地板高，这种情况出现在地板较低的列车所经停的车站是为地板较高的列车而建的，比如德国联邦铁路北威州区域铁路停靠在荷兰火车站。

column1: On the London Underground some stations are served by both District line and Piccadilly line trains, and the Piccadilly trains have lower floors.
column2: 伦敦地铁的一些地铁站经停区域线和皮卡迪利线两条线，其中皮卡迪利线就是车厢地板较低的。

column1: A tram stop is often in the middle of the street; usually it has as a platform a refuge area of a similar height to that of the sidewalk (e.g. 100 mm (3.9 in)), and sometimes has no platform.
column2: 有轨电车车站一般位于街道中央，通常有一个作为站台的安全区，高度与人行道的高度（如 100 毫米（3.9 英寸）高）差不多。有些时候，有轨电车会不设站台。

column1: The latter requires extra care by passengers and other traffic to avoid accidents.
column2: 没有站台则需要行人及来往车辆格外小心，以免发生事故。

column1: Both types of tram stops can be seen in the tram networks of Melbourne and Toronto.
column2: 这两种类型的有轨电车停靠站，在墨尔本和多伦多的有轨电车网络中都可以看到。

column1: Sometimes a tram stop is served by ordinary trams with rather low floors and metro-like light rail vehicles with higher floors, and the tram stop has a dual-height platform, as in Amstelveen, Netherlands.
column2: 有时，有轨电车停靠站会有地板很低的普通有轨电车以及地板较高类似地铁的轻轨经停，这时，有轨电车停靠站的站台就会有两种高度，如荷兰的阿姆斯特尔芬就是这种情况。

column1: A train station may be served by heavy-rail and light-rail vehicles with lower floors and have a dual- height platform, as on the RijnGouweLijn in the Netherlands.
column2: 火车站可能会有车厢地板较低的重轨和轻轨两种列车经停，这种车站站台会设两种高度，如荷兰的 Rijn Gouwellijn 火车站。

column1: Platform types include the bay platform, side platform (also called through platform), split platform and island platform.
column2: 站台类型包括港湾式站台、侧式站台（也叫岸式站台）、分离式站台以及岛式站台。

column1: A bay platform is one at which the track terminates, i.e. a dead-end or siding.
column2: 港湾式站台是铁路终点站台，如铁路尽头或支线处。

column1: Trains serving a bay platform must reverse in or out.
column2: 列车必须以进站（出站）时的颠倒方向驶出（驶入）港湾式站台。

column1: A side platform is the more usual type, alongside tracks where the train arrives from one end and leaves towards the other.
column2: 侧式站台是更为常见的一种站台，位于轨道线路一侧，火车会从一端驶进，从另一端驶离。

column1: An island platform has through platforms on both sides; it may be indented on one or both ends, with bay platforms.
column2: 岛式站台两边都有侧式站台，它可能会在一端或两端凹进去，形成港湾式站台。

column1: To reach an island platform there may be a bridge, a tunnel, or a level crossing.
column2: 到达岛式站台可能要经过一个桥、隧道或平交道口。

column1: A variant on the side platform is the spanish solution which has platforms on both sides of a single through track.
column2: 还有一种侧式站台是西班牙式站台，一条轨道两侧都有站台。

column1: Some of the station facilities are often located on the platforms.
column2: 车站的一些设施通常设在站台上。

column1: Where the platforms are not adjacent to a station building, often some form of shelter or waiting room is provided, and employee cabins may also be present.
column2: 如果站台不毗邻车站，站台上一般会设某种形式的遮阳棚或候车室，也可能设有工作人员管理室。

column1: The weather protection offered varies greatly, from little more than a roof with open sides, to a closed room with heating or air-conditioning.
column2: 能遮风挡雨的设施种类很多，从单纯一个四面开放的棚顶，到配有暖气或空调的封闭空间。

column1: There may be benches, lighting, ticket counters, drinking fountains, shops, trash boxes, and static timetables or dynamic displays with information about the next train.
column2: 可能会提供长凳、照明设备、售票柜台、饮水机、商店、垃圾箱、静态的列车时刻表以及下一趟列车的动态信息显示。

column1: There are often loudspeakers as part of a public address (PA) system.
column2: 通常会有喇叭，作为公共广播（PA）系统的一部分。

column1: The PA system is often used where dynamic timetables or electronic displays are not present.
column2: 在没有动态列车时刻表或电子显示设备时，往往就会用到公共广播系统。

column1: A variety of information is presented, including destinations and times (for all trains, or only the more important long-distance trains), delays, cancellations, platform changes, changes in routes and destinations, the number of carriages in the train and the location of first class or luggage compartments, and supplementary fee or reservation requirements.
column2: 它可以提供各种各样的重要信息，包括目的地和时间（可能用于所有列车，也可能只用于比较重要的长途列车）、延误、取消、站台变更、路线和目的地变更、列车车厢数、头等车厢或行李箱所处的位置以及附加费用或预定要求等。

column1: Some metro stations have platform screen doors between the platforms and the tracks.
column2: 一些地铁站会在站台与铁轨之间设置屏蔽门。

column1: They provide more safety, and they allow the heating or air conditioning in the station to be separated from the ventilation in the tunnel, thus being more efficient and effective.
column2: 屏蔽门带来了更高的安全性，而且可以将车站内的暖气或冷气与隧道内的通风隔离开来，从而使车站耗能更少，效率更高。

column1: They have been installed in most stations of the Singapore MRT and the Hong Kong MTR, and stations on the Jubilee Line Extension in London.
column2: 新加坡地铁和香港地铁的大部分站点以及伦敦地铁银禧延长线的站点都安装了这些屏蔽门。

column1: Platforms should be sloped upwards slightly towards the platform edge to prevent wheeled objects such as trolleys, prams and wheelchairs from rolling away and into the path of the train.
column2: 为防止手推车、婴儿车、轮椅等带轮物体失控滑落到铁轨上，站台应该稍微朝站台边缘向上倾斜。

column1: Many platforms have a cavity underneath an overhanging edge so that people who may fall off the platform can seek shelter from incoming trains.
column2: 很多站台在向外凸出的边缘下方设有一个洞，这样如果有人从站台失足掉下来，就可以躲过疾驰而来的地铁，捡回一命。

column1: A dangerous practice is sitting on the edge of the platform, which requires withdrawing the legs fast enough when a train arrives.
column2: 坐在站台边缘是一种很危险的行为，因为这意味着列车进站时要以足够快的速度缩回双腿。

column1: In high-speed rail, passing trains are a significant safety problem as the safe distance from the platform edge increases with the speed of the passing train.
column2: 在高速铁路中，随着列车运行速度的增大，与站台边缘的安全距离也随之增加，因此，列车的经过是一个重大的安全问题。

column1: A study done by the United States Department of Transportation in 1999 found that trains passing station platforms at speeds of 240 kilometres per hour (150 mph) can pose safety concerns to passengers on the platforms who are 2 metres (6.6 ft) away from the edge due to the aerodynamic effects created by pressure and induced airflow with speeds of 64 kilometres per hour (40 mph) to 95 kilometres per hour (59 mph) depending on the train body aerodynamic designs.
column2: 美国运输部 1999 年的一项研究发现，列车以每小时 240 公里（150 英里）的速度经过车站站台时，会对站台上距离站台边缘 2 米（6.6 英尺）的乘客造成安全隐患，因为当时的压力和诱导气流速度达到每小时 64 公里（40 英里/小时）至每小时 95 公里（59 英里/小时），具体视列车车身的空气动力学设计而定，这种情况下会产生空气动力学效应。

column1: Additionally, the airflow can cause debris to be blown out to the waiting passengers.
column2: 而且，在气流的作用下碎片会飞溅到正在候车的乘客身上。

column1: If the passengers stand closer at 1 metre (3.3 ft), the risk increases with airflow that can reach speeds of 79 kilometres per hour (49 mph) to 116 kilometres per hour (72 mph).
column2: 如果乘客站得更近，比如离站台仅 1 米（3.3 英尺），则会更加危险，因为此时的气流速度可达每小时 79 千米（49 英里/小时）至 116 公里每小时（72 英里/小时）。

column1: In United Kingdom, a guideline for platform safety specifies that for the platforms with train passing speeds between 160 kilometres per hour (99 mph) and 200 kilometres per hour (120 mph), there should be a yellow-line buffer zone of 1.5 metres (4.9 ft) and other warning signs.
column2: 在英国，一项关于站台安全的指南规定，对于列车通过速度在 160 公里/小时（99 英里/小时）到 200 公里/小时（120 英里/小时）之间的站台，应设置 1.5 米（4.9 英尺）黄色缓冲带和其他警告标志。

column1: If trains can pass at speeds higher than 200 kilometres per hour (120 mph), the platforms should be inaccessible to passengers unless there are waiting rooms or screened areas to provide protection.
column2: 如果列车经过速度高于 200 公里/小时（120 英里/小时），应禁止乘客进入站台，除非站台设有可护乘客安全的候车室或屏蔽区。

column1: The European Union has a regulation for platforms that are close to tracks with train passing speeds of 250 kilometres per hour (160 mph) or more should not be accessible to passengers unless there is a lower speed limit for trains that intend to stop at the station or there are barriers to limit access.
column2: 欧盟则规定，列车通过速度达 250 公里/小时（160 英里/小时）或更高时，靠近铁轨的站台不应向乘客开放，除非对拟停在本站的列车有限速规定，或设置了限制乘客进入的栅栏。

column1: Platforms usually have some form of warnings or measures to keep passengers away from the tracks.
column2: 站台一般设有某种形式的警告或措施来让乘客远离铁轨。

column1: The simplest measure is markings near the edge of the platform to demarcate the distance back that passengers should remain.
column2: 最简单的措施是在靠近站台边缘的地方做标记，划出乘客应该保持的距离。

column1: Often a special tiled surface is used as well as a painted line, to help blind people using a walking aid, and help in preventing wheelchairs from rolling too near the platform edge.
column2: 除画线外，站台通常还铺设一个特殊的瓷砖表面，作为盲道帮助盲人通行，同时防止轮椅滑过时太靠近站台边缘。

column1: In the US, Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 regulations require a detectable warning strip 24 inches (61 cm) wide, consisting of truncated dome bumps in a visually-contrasting color, for the full length of the platform.
column2: 美国 1990 年颁行的《美国残疾人法案》规定，车站必须铺设一条长度与整个站台同长、宽 24 英寸（61 厘米）的易于发现的警示带，警示带必须带有扁圆点状凸起，颜色看起来要鲜明。

column1: Ideally platforms should be straight or slightly convex, so that the guard can see the whole train when preparing to close the doors.
column2: 理想情况下，站台应该是直的或略微凸出的，这样列车长在准备关门的时候才能看见整个列车。

column1: Platforms that have great curvature have blind spots that create a safety hazard.
column2: 曲度大的站台会造成视觉盲点，导致安全隐患。

column1: Mirrors or closed-circuit cameras may be used in these cases to view the whole platform.
column2: 这种情况下，列车长可能会用镜子或闭路摄像头来查看整个站台。

column1: Also passenger carriages are straight, so doors will not always open directly onto a curved platform – often a platform gap is present.
column2: 而且，由于车厢是直的，车门打开后无法与弯曲的站台很好地衔接，往往就会留下一条站台缝隙。

column1: Usually such platforms will have warning signs, possibly auditory, such as London Underground's famous phrase "Mind the gap".
column2: 这样的站台通常会设警告信号，可能是以提示声的形式，比如伦敦地铁那句著名的“小心缝隙”。

column1: There may be moveable gap filler sections within the platform, extending once the train has stopped and retracting after the doors have closed.
column2: 站台内可能会设置可移动的缝隙填充物，列车停下时延伸出来，列车关闭时收缩回去。

column1: The New York City Subway employs these at 14th Street–Union Square on the IRT Lexington Avenue Line and at Times Square on the 42nd Street Shuttle, and formerly at the South Ferry outer loop station on the IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line.
column2: 纽约地铁的 IRT 列克星敦大道线 14 号街联合广场站以及时代广场 42   街接驳线就设置了这种填充物。之前 IRT 百老汇-第七大道线的南码头外环站也用过这个办法。

column1: In the UK, recent rules require new platforms to be straight.
column2: 英国最近的规定要求新的站台必须是直的。

column1: Flip-flops are a type of sandal, typically worn as a form of casual wear.
column2: 人字拖是一种凉鞋，尤其用于休闲穿搭。

column1: They consist of a flat sole held loosely on the foot by a Y-shaped strap known as a toe thong that passes between the first and second toes and around both sides of the foot or can be a hard base with a strap across all the toes (these can also be called sliders).
column2: 它们由平坦的鞋底和松松地挂在脚上的 Y 型带子（又名脚趾带）组成，带子会穿过第一和第二根脚趾，然后延伸至脚的两侧，也可能是由硬鞋底和横跨所有脚趾的带子组成（又称拖鞋）。

column1: This style of footwear has been worn by the people of many cultures throughout the world, originating as early as the ancient Egyptians in 1,500 B.C.
column2: 全球各种文化的人们都会穿这种类型的鞋子，这种鞋子最早起源于公元前 1,500 年的古埃及。

column1: In the United States the flip-flop descends from the Japanese zōri, which became popular after World War II as soldiers brought them back from Japan.
column2: 在美国，人字拖鞋来源于日本的 zōri。第二次世界大战后士兵将其从日本带回美国，从此流行起来。

column1: They became popular unisex summer footwear starting in the 1960s.
column2: 20 世纪 60 年代，它们成为流行的中性夏日鞋款。

column1: The term flip-flop has been used in American and British English since the 1960s to describe the thong or no-heel-strap sandal.
column2: 20 世纪 60 年代起，美式英语和英式英语用 flip-flop 一词来描述人字拖鞋或没有跟的有带凉鞋。

column1: It is an onomatopoeia of the sound made by the sandals when walking in them.
column2: 这是穿着凉鞋走路时发出的声音的拟声词。

column1: They are called thongs (sometimes pluggers) in Australia, jandals (originally a trademarked name derived from "Japanese sandals") in New Zealand, slops or “visplakkies” in South Africa and Zimbabwe, and tsinelas or step-in in the Philippines (or, in some Visayan localities, "smagol", from the word smuggled).
column2: 它们在澳大利亚被称为 thongs（有时也叫 pluggers），在新西兰被称为 jandals（原本是“日本木屐”的品牌名），在南非和津巴布韦被称为 slops 或“visplakkies”，在菲律宾被称为 tsinelas 或 step-in（或在米沙鄢地区被称为“smagol”，来源于 smuggled 一词）。

column1: This footwear has a number of other names around the world.
column2: 这种鞋子在全球范围内还有多种名字。

column1: The Japanese wear similarly designed, traditional straw sandals known as zōri.
column2: 日本人穿着类似设计的传统草鞋，名为 zōri。

column1: Throughout the world, they are known by a variety of other names, including dép tông or dép xỏ ngón in Vietnam, chinelos in Brazil, japonki in Poland, dacas in Somalia, sayonares (σαγιονάρες) in Greece, slippers in Hawaii, Bahamas, Trinidad and Tobago and the Netherlands, infradito in Italy, djapanki (джапанки) in Bulgaria,"charlie wote" in Ghana, "japanke" in Croatia and vietnamki in Russia and Ukraine, yezenes in Latvia.
column2: 在全球范围内，它们还有其他多种名字，包括越南的 dép tông 或 dép xỏ ngón、巴西的 chinelos、波兰的 japonki、索马里的 dacas、希腊的 sayonares (σαγιονάρες)、夏威夷、巴哈马、特立尼达和多巴哥以及荷兰的 slippers、意大利的 infradito、保加利亚的 djapanki (джапанки)、加纳的“charlie wote”、克罗地亚的“japanke”以及俄罗斯和乌克兰的 vietnamki、拉脱维亚的 yezenes。

column1: They were introduced by Bata in India under the brand name Hawaii slippers and are extremely popular throughout the country.
column2: 它们由 Bata 引入印度，隶属 Hawaii slippers 品牌旗下，风靡全国。

column1: Thong sandals have been worn for thousands of years, dating back to pictures of them in ancient Egyptian murals from 4,000 BC.
column2: 人字拖鞋已有数千年历史，最早可以追溯到公元前 4,000 年的古埃及壁画。

column1: A pair found in Europe was made of papyrus leaves and dated to be approximately 1,500 years old.
column2: 在欧洲发现了一双由纸莎草叶子制成的鞋子，已有将近 1,500 年历史。

column1: These early versions of flip-flops were made from a wide variety of materials.
column2: 这些早期的人字拖鞋由多种材质制成。

column1: Ancient Egyptian sandals were made from papyrus and palm leaves.
column2: 古埃及的凉鞋由纸莎草和棕榈叶制成。

column1: The Masai of Africa made them out of rawhide.
column2: 非洲马赛族人用生牛皮制作。

column1: In India, they were made from wood.
column2: 在印度，它们由木头制成。

column1: In China and Japan, rice straw was used.
column2: 中国人和日本人使用稻草。

column1: The leaves of the sisal plant were used to make twine for sandals in South America, while the natives of Mexico used the yucca plant.
column2: 南非人用剑麻的叶子来制作凉鞋的带子，而墨西哥土著使用丝兰。

column1: The Ancient Greeks and Romans wore versions of flip-flops as well.
column2: 古埃及人和罗马人也穿不同版本的人字拖鞋。

column1: In Greek sandals, the toe strap was worn between the first and second toes, while Roman sandals had the strap between the second and third toes.
column2: 希腊凉鞋的带子穿过第一和第二个脚趾之间，但罗马凉鞋的带子穿过第二和第三个脚趾之间。

column1: These differ from the sandals worn by the Mesopotamians, with the strap between the third and fourth toes.
column2: 这些与美索不达米亚人穿的凉鞋不一样，它们的带子穿过第三和第四个脚趾之间。

column1: In India, a related chappal ("toe knob") sandal was common, with no straps but a small knob sitting between the first and second toes.
column2: 一种类似的夹趾凉鞋在印度很流行，这种凉鞋没有带子，但在第一和第二个脚趾之间有一个小结。

column1: They are known as Padukas.
column2: 它们被称为 Padukas。

column1: The modern flip-flop became popular in the United States as soldiers returning from World War II brought Japanese zōri with them.
column2: 美国士兵在第二次世界大战后带回了日本的 zōri，现代人字拖鞋开始在美国流行起来。

column1: It caught on in the 1950s during the postwar boom and after the end of hostilities of the Korean War.
column2: 它在 20 世纪 50 年代战后繁荣时期以及朝鲜战争后流行起来。

column1: As they became adopted into American popular culture, the sandals were redesigned and changed into the bright colors that dominated 1950s design.
column2: 这种凉鞋逐渐融入美国流行文化，在 20 世纪 50 年代时被重新设计，并采用明亮颜色。

column1: They quickly became popular due to their convenience and comfort, and were popular in beach-themed stores and as summer shoes.
column2: 由于其便利性和舒适性，它们迅速流行起来，成为海滩商店的热销鞋款以及人们的夏日首选。

column1: During the 1960s, flip-flops became firmly associated with the beach lifestyle of California.
column2: 20 世纪 60 年代，人字拖鞋与加利福尼亚的海滩生活紧密联系起来。

column1: As such, they were promoted as primarily a casual accessory, typically worn with shorts, bathing suits, or summer dresses.
column2: 因此，它们被营销为一种休闲配饰，用于搭配短裤、游泳衣或夏日裙子。

column1: As they became more popular, some people started wearing them for dressier or more formal occasions.
column2: 由于它们越来越流行，有的人开始在衣着更讲究或更正式的场合穿着它们。

column1: In 1962, Alpargatas marketed a version of flip-flops known as Havaianas in Brazil.
column2: 1962 年，Alpargatas 开始在巴西推销一款名为哈瓦那的人字拖鞋。

column1: By 2010, more than 150 million pairs of Havaianas were produced each year.
column2: 到 2010 年为止，每年都要生产超过 1.5 亿双哈瓦那拖鞋。

column1: Flip-flops quickly became popular as casual footwear of young adults.
column2: 人字拖鞋迅速成为受年轻人欢迎的休闲鞋款。

column1: Girls would often decorate their flip-flops with metallic finishes, charms, chains, beads, rhinestones, or other jewelry.
column2: 女孩们会用金属饰品、挂饰、链条、珠子、莱茵石或其他宝石来装饰人字拖鞋。

column1: High-end flip-flops made of leather or sophisticated synthetic materials are commonly worn in place of sneakers or loafers as the standard, everyday article of casual footwear, particularly among teenagers and young adults, although it is not unusual to see older people wearing playful, thick-soled flip-flops in brilliant colors.
column2: 皮制或复杂合成材料制成的高端人字拖鞋通常会替代运动鞋或乐福鞋作为每天标准的休闲鞋款使用，特别是青少年和年轻人，但也很常见年纪较大的人穿着亮色的厚底人字拖鞋。

column1: Platform and high-heel variants began to appear in the 1990s.
column2: 20 世纪 90 年代，开始出现厚底和高跟的款式。

column1: A minor controversy erupted in 2005 when some members of Northwestern University's national champion women's lacrosse team visited the White House wearing flip-flops.
column2: 2005 年时发生了一起小争议，当时西北大学国家冠军女子长曲棍球队的部分队员在参观白宫时穿了人字拖鞋。

column1: The team responded to critics by auctioning off their flip-flops on eBay, raising $1,653 USD for young cancer patient, Jaclyn Murphy of Hopewell Junction, New York, who was befriended by the team.
column2: 面对批评的言论，该团队将他们的人字拖鞋放在 eBay 上拍卖，为来自纽约 Hopewell Junction 的年轻癌症患者贾克琳·墨菲筹集了 1,653 美元，她也是这个团队的朋友。

column1: There is still a debate over whether this signaled a fundamental change in American culture — many youth feel that flip-flops are dressier and can be worn in a variety of social contexts, while older generations feel that wearing them at formal occasions signifies laziness and comfort over style.
column2: 人们仍在争论这是否代表着美国文化发生彻底变化。许多年轻人认为人字拖鞋也比较正式，可以在多种社交场合穿着，但老一代认为在正式场合穿人字拖鞋意味着懒惰和过于舒适。

column1: In 2011, while vacationing in his native Hawaii, Barack Obama became the first President of the United States to be photographed wearing a pair of flip-flops.
column2: 2011 年，贝拉克·奥巴马在出生地夏威夷度假时，成为第一位被拍到穿着人字拖鞋的美国总统。

column1: The Dalai Lama of Tibet is also a frequent wearer of flip-flops and has met with several U.S. presidents, including George W. Bush and Barack Obama, while wearing the sandals.
column2: 西藏的达赖喇嘛也很常穿人字拖鞋，在与包括乔治·布什和贝拉克·奥巴马在内的多位美国总统会面时都穿着凉鞋。

column1: While exact sales figures for flip-flops are difficult to obtain due to the large number of stores and manufacturers involved, the Atlanta-based company Flip Flop Shops claimed that the shoes were responsible for a $20 billion industry in 2009.
column2: 虽然由于商店和厂家的数量庞大，很难获得确切的人字拖鞋销售数据，但在 2009 年，一家总部在亚特兰大的公司 Flip Flop Shops 声称人字拖鞋带来了 200 亿美元的收益。

column1: Furthermore, sales of flip-flops exceeded those of sneakers for the first time in 2006.
column2: 2006 年，人字拖鞋的销量甚至首次超过了运动鞋的销量。

column1: If these figures are accurate, it is remarkable considering the low cost of most flip-flops.
column2: 如果这些数据是准确的，考虑到大部分人字拖鞋的成本很低，这是个惊人的事实。

column1: The modern flip-flop has a very simple design, consisting of a thin rubber sole with two straps running in a Y shape from the sides of the foot to the gap between the big toe and the one beside it.
column2: 现代人字拖鞋设计简约，包括薄的橡胶鞋底和两条 Y 型带子，带子从脚的两侧一直延伸至大脚趾和第二个脚趾之间。

column1: They typically do not have a strap around the heel, although heeled varieties are available, as well as flip-flops designed for sports, which come with added support common to athletic shoes, with the thong between the toes.
column2: 虽然有高跟的版本，但通常跟部没有带子。此外也有专为运动设计的人字拖鞋，带有运动鞋常见的附加支撑以及脚趾处的人型带子。

column1: Most modern flip-flops are inexpensive, costing as little as $5 USD, or less in some parts of the world.
column2: 大部分现代人字拖鞋价格便宜，只需 5 美元，在部分地区价格甚至更低。

column1: They are made from a wide variety of materials, as were the ancient thong sandals.
column2: 与老式人字拖鞋一样，它们也由多种材料制成。

column1: The modern sandals are made of more modern materials, such as rubber, foam, plastic, leather, suede, and even fabric.
column2: 现代凉鞋会由更现代的材料制成，包括橡胶、海绵、塑料、皮革、绒面革，甚至还有布料。

column1: Thongs made of polyurethane have caused some environmental concerns; because polyurethane is a number 7 resin, they can't be easily discarded, and they persist in landfills for a very long time.
column2: 聚氨酯制成的人字拖鞋引发了一些对环境的担忧，因为聚氨酯是 7 号树脂，难以分解，会在垃圾填埋场保存很长一段时间。

column1: In response to these concerns, some companies have begun selling flip-flops made from recycled rubber, such as that from used bicycle tires, or even hemp, and some offer a recycling program for used flip flops.
column2: 为了回应这些担忧，有的公司开始销售用可回收橡胶（例如从自行车旧轮胎上回收的）或大麻制成的人字拖鞋，有的公司为旧的人字拖鞋提供回收计划。

column1: Because of the strap between the toes, flip-flops are typically not worn with socks.
column2: 由于脚趾中间有带子，人字拖鞋通常不会搭配袜子穿着。

column1: In colder weather, however, some people wear flip-flops with toe socks.
column2: 但是天气冷的时候，有的人会用分趾袜搭配人字拖。

column1: The Japanese commonly wear tabi, a type of sock with a single slot for the thong, with their zōri.
column2: 日本人通常会穿足袋，这是专为 zōri 设计的分趾袜子。

column1: While flip-flops do provide the wearer with some mild protection from hazards on the ground, such as hot sand at the beach, glass, thumb tacks or even fungi and wart-causing viruses in locker rooms or community pools, their simple design is responsible for a host of other injuries of the foot and lower leg.
column2: 虽然人字拖鞋确实能为穿着者提供轻微防护，免受地面隐患危害，例如沙滩的热沙、玻璃、图钉，甚至还可以在更衣室或社区游泳池里避免感染真菌或导致疣的病毒，但其简单的设计可以回导致脚部和小腿遭受其它伤害。

column1: Walking for long periods in flip-flops can be very tough on the feet, resulting in pain in the ankles, legs, and feet.
column2: 长时间穿着人字拖鞋走路对脚非常不好，可能会导致脚踝、腿部和脚部疼痛。

column1: A 2009 study at Auburn University found that flip-flop wearers took shorter steps and their heels hit the ground with less vertical force than those wearing athletic shoes.
column2: 奥本大学 2009 年的研究发现，与运动鞋穿着者相比，人字拖鞋穿着者步伐更小，鞋跟碰地时垂直方向的力量更小。

column1: Individuals with flat feet or other foot issues are advised to wear a shoe with better support.
column2: 患有扁平足或其他足部问题的个人建议穿支撑力更好的鞋子。

column1: The lack of support provided by thong sandals is thought by some to be a major cause of injuries.
column2: 有的人认为由于人字拖鞋缺乏支撑力，更容易造成伤害。

column1: Some flip-flops have a spongy sole, causing the foot to roll further inward than normal when it hits the ground (over-pronation).
column2: 有的人字拖鞋鞋底柔软，导致足部在落地时比平常更向内卷（足外翻）。

column1: Flip-flops can cause a person to overuse the tendons in their feet, resulting in tendonitis.
column2: 人字拖鞋会导致足部肌腱使用过度，最终造成肌腱炎。

column1: Ankle sprains or broken bones are also common injuries, due to stepping off a curb or tumbling; the ankle bends, but the flip-flop neither holds on to nor supports it.
column2: 由于走下路缘或摔倒，很容易造成脚踝扭伤或骨头断裂；脚踝弯曲时，人字拖鞋不跟脚或无法支撑它。

column1: The straps of the flip-flop may cause frictional issues, such as rubbing, during walking.
column2: 走路时，人字拖鞋的带子可能会导致摩擦问题，例如磨脚。

column1: The open-toed nature of the thongs may result in cuts, scrapes, bruises, or stubbed toes.
column2: 由于人字拖鞋无法包裹脚趾，可能会造成割伤、划伤、瘀伤或踢到脚趾。

column1: Despite all of these issues, flip-flops do not have to be avoided completely.
column2: 尽管有这些问题存在，但没有必要完全避免穿着人字拖鞋。

column1: Many podiatrists recommend avoiding the inexpensive, drug store varieties and spending more on sandals with thick-cushioned soles, as well as ones that have a strap that's not canvas and that comes back almost to the ankle.
column2: 许多足科医生建议避免在药妆店购买平价凉鞋，应该花多点钱购买有厚底的凉鞋以及带子材质不是帆布并且覆盖面接近脚踝的凉鞋。

column1: A paper clip (or sometimes paperclip) is a device used to hold sheets of paper together, usually made of steel wire bent to a looped shape (though some are covered in plastic).
column2: 回形针是用来固定多张纸张的工具，通常用钢丝制成，弯成环形（有的表面会用塑料覆盖）。

column1: Most paper clips are variations of the Gem type introduced in the 1890s or earlier, characterized by the almost two full loops made by the wire.
column2: 大多数回形针的原型都是 19 世纪 90 年代或更早出现的宝石型回形针，其特点是钢丝被弯成了两个几乎完整的圆形。

column1: Common to paper clips proper is their utilization of torsion and elasticity in the wire, and friction between wire and paper.
column2: 回形针的原理是利用了钢丝的可弯曲性和弹性，以及钢丝和纸张之间的摩擦力。

column1: When a moderate number of sheets are inserted between the two "tongues" of the clip, the tongues will be forced apart and cause torsion in the bend of the wire to grip the sheets together.
column2: 当在回形针两“舌”之间插入合适数量的纸张时，回形针的两舌会被分开，发生弯曲，并将纸张固定在一起。

column1: Paper clips usually have an oblong shape with straight sides, but may also be triangular or circular, or have more elaborate shapes.
column2: 回形针的形状通常是有直边的椭圆形，但也可能是三角形或圆形，或是更复杂的形状。

column1: The most common material is steel or some other metal, but moulded plastic is also used.
column2: 最常用的材料是钢或其他金属，但也会使用模压塑料。

column1: Some other kinds of paper clip use a two-piece clamping system.
column2: 有些其他类型的回形针会使用两片夹紧的结构。

column1: Recent innovations include multi-colored plastic-coated paper clips and spring-fastened binder clips.
column2: 最新的创新产品包括多彩涂塑回形针和弹簧装订夹。

column1: According to the Early Office Museum, the first patent for a bent wire paper clip was awarded in the United States to Samuel B. Fay in 1867.
column2: 根据早期办公室博物馆，首个弯曲钢丝回形针的专利于 1867 年在美国颁给了塞缪尔·B·费伊。

column1: This clip was originally intended primarily for attaching tickets to fabric, although the patent recognized that it could be used to attach papers together.
column2: 虽然专利认可回形针可以用来把纸张固定在一起，但这种回形针最早用于将标签固定在布料上。

column1: Fay received U.S. patent 64,088 on April 23, 1867.
column2: 1867 年 4 月 23 日，费伊收到了美国专利 64,088 号。

column1: Although functional and practical, Fay's design along with the 50 other designs patented prior to 1899 are not considered reminiscent of the modern paperclip design known today.
column2: 虽然这些设计很实用，但费伊的设计以及 1899 年以前取得专利的其他 50 种设计都不会让人联想起今天的现代回形针设计。

column1: Another notable paper clip design was also patented in the United States by Erlman J. Wright in 1877.
column2: 另一种著名的回形针设计也是由艾尔曼·J·赖特于 1877 年在美国获得专利。

column1: This clip was advertised at that time for use in fastening newspapers.
column2: 当时的广告宣传称这种回形针可用于固定报纸。

column1: The most common type of wire paper clip still in use, the Gem paper clip, was never patented, but it was most likely in production in Britain in the early 1870s by "The Gem Manufacturing Company", according to the American expert on technological innovations, Professor Henry J. Petroski.
column2: 研究科技创新的美国专家亨利·J·彼得罗斯基教授表示，宝石型回形针是如今仍在使用的最常见的钢丝回形针类型，从未获得专利，但最可能是由“The Gem Manufacturing Company”于 19 世纪 70 年代在英国生产的。

column1: He refers to an 1883 article about "Gem Paper-Fasteners", praising them for being "better than ordinary pins" for "binding together papers on the same subject, a bundle of letters, or pages of a manuscript".
column2: 他提到了 1883 年有关“宝石纸张固定器”的文章，赞扬它们在“同一个物体上固定纸张、固定一堆信件或多页手稿”时“比普通别针更好用”。

column1: Since the 1883 article had no illustration of this early "Gem", it may have been different from modern paper clips of that name.
column2: 由于 1883 年的文章中没有附上早期“宝石”的图片，可能会与现代同名回形针有所不同。

column1: The earliest illustration of its current form is in an 1893 advertisement for the "Gem Paper Clip".
column2: 它现在形态最早的图片出现在 1893 年“宝石回形针”的广告中。

column1: In 1904 Cushman & Denison registered a trademark for the "Gem" name in connection with paper clips.
column2: 1904 年，Cushman & Denison 为回形针注册了“宝石”这个名字的商标。

column1: The announcement stated that it had been used since March 1, 1892, which may have been the time of its introduction in the United States.
column2: 公告表示它自 1892 年 3 月 1 日开始使用，这可能是引入美国的时间。

column1: Paper clips are still sometimes called "Gem clips", and in Swedish the word for any paper clip is "gem".
column2: 回形针有时仍被称为“宝石针”，瑞典语用“gem”表示所有类型的回形针。

column1: Definite proof that the modern type of paper clip was well known in 1899 at the latest, is the patent granted to William Middlebrook of Waterbury, Connecticut on April 27 of that year for a "Machine for making wire paper clips." The drawing clearly shows that the product is a perfect clip of the Gem type.
column2: 现代回形针的确切证据可以追溯到最近的 1899 年。在那一年的 4 月 27 日，康涅狄格州沃特伯里的威廉·米德尔布鲁克因“制作钢丝回形针的机器”获得了专利。图片清晰显示了那个回形针恰好是宝石型的回形针。

column1: The fact that Middlebrook did not mention it by name, suggests that it was already well known at the time.
column2: 米德尔布鲁克没有以自己的名字来命名，这说明当时它已经很出名了。

column1: Since then countless variations on the same theme have been patented.
column2: 从那以后，同个物品的无数变体获得了专利。

column1: Some have pointed instead of rounded ends, some have the end of one loop bent slightly to make it easier to insert sheets of paper, and some have wires with undulations or barbs to get a better grip.
column2: 有的是尖头的而不是圆头的；有的尾部的圆环会微微弯曲，更容易插入纸张；有的钢丝上有凸起或小勾，能起到更好的固定作用。

column1: In addition, purely aesthetic variants have been patented, clips with triangular, star, or round shapes.
column2: 此外，纯美观的版本也获得了专利，例如三角形、星形或圆形的回形针。

column1: But the original Gem type has for more than a hundred years proved to be the most practical, and consequently by far the most popular.
column2: 但是拥有一百年历史的原始宝石型是最实用的，因此也最受欢迎。

column1: Its qualities—ease of use, gripping without tearing, and storing without tangling—have been difficult to improve upon.
column2: 它的品质（容易使用、固定却不会拉扯以及有序存放）已经达到最佳水平。

column1: National Paperclip Day is May 29.
column2: 国际回形针日是 5 月 29 日。

column1: It has been claimed, though apparently without evidence, that Herbert Spencer, the originator of the term "survival of the fittest", invented the paper clip.
column2: 虽然明显没有证据，但据称“适者生存”一词的创始人赫伯特·斯宾塞发明了回形针。

column1: Spencer claimed in his autobiography to have invented a "binding-pin" that was distributed by Ackermann & Company, and he shows a drawing of the pin in his Appendix I (following Appendix H).
column2: 斯宾塞在自传中声称他发明了一种“装订别针”，由 Ackermann & Company 进行分销，他还在附录 I（以下附录 H）中展示了这种别针的图片。

column1: This pin looked more like a modern cotter pin than a modern paper clip, but it was designed to hold sheets of paper together.
column2: 这种别针看起来更像今天的开口销，而不是今天的回形针，但它的确用于固定纸张。

column1: It is approximately 15 cm unfolded.
column2: 它展开大约长 15 厘米。

column1: A Norwegian, Johan Vaaler (1866–1910), has erroneously been identified as the inventor of the paper clip.
column2: 挪威人约翰·瓦勒（1866—1910）被错认为回形针的发明者。

column1: He was granted patents in Germany and in the United States (1901) for a paper clip of similar design, but less functional and practical, because it lacked the last turn of the wire.
column2: 他的类似设计的回形针在德国和美国（1901）获得了专利，但这种回形针没那么实用，因为钢丝的最后部分没有弯曲。

column1: Vaaler probably did not know that a better product was already on the market, although not yet in Norway.
column2: 瓦勒可能不知道市场上已经有更好的产品，虽然在挪威还未存在。

column1: His version was never manufactured and never marketed, because the superior Gem was already available.
column2: 他的版本从未进行生产和市场营销，因为已经有更好的宝石版本。

column1: Long after Vaaler's death his countrymen created a national myth based on the false assumption that the paper clip was invented by an unrecognised Norwegian genius.
column2: 在瓦勒逝世很长时间后，他的同胞编造了一个国家传说，错误地认为是一位得不到认可的挪威天才发明了回形针。

column1: Norwegian dictionaries since the 1950s have mentioned Vaaler as the inventor of the paper clip, and that myth later found its way into international dictionaries and much of the international literature on paper clips.
column2: 自 20 世纪 50 年代起，挪威词典称瓦勒为回形针的发明者，随后国际词典和许多有关回形针的国际文学也收录了这个传说。

column1: Vaaler probably succeeded in having his design patented abroad, despite the previous existence of more useful paper clips, because patent authorities at that time were quite liberal and rewarded any marginal modification of existing inventions.
column2: 虽然此前已有更实用的回形针，但瓦勒可能成功地在国外为他的设计获得了专利，因为当时的专利机构相当慷慨，会给现有发明的任何类似修改版本颁发专利。

column1: Johan Vaaler began working for Alfred J. Bryns Patentkontor in Kristiania in 1892 and was later promoted to office manager, a position he held until his death.
column2: 1892 年，约翰·瓦勒开始在克里斯蒂安尼亚的 Alfred J. Bryns Patentkontor 工作，后来晋升为办公室经理，一直在这个职位上工作到逝世。

column1: As the employee of a patent office, he could easily have obtained a patent in Norway.
column2: 作为专利办公室的员工，他很容易就在挪威获得了专利。

column1: His reasons for applying abroad are not known; it is possible that he wanted to secure the commercial rights internationally.
column2: 无人知晓他在国外申请的原因；可能是因为他想确保在国际上拥有商事权。

column1: Also, he may have been aware that a Norwegian manufacturer would find it difficult to introduce a new invention abroad, starting from the small home market.
column2: 此外，他可能也意识到挪威制造商很难从小的当地市场向国外引入新的发明。

column1: Vaaler's patents expired quietly, while the "Gem" was used worldwide, including his own country.
column2: 瓦勒的专利悄无声息地过期了，而“宝石”却在全球范围广泛使用，包括他自己的国家。

column1: The failure of his design was its impracticality.
column2: 他设计的失败之处在于不够实用。

column1: Without the two full loops of the fully developed paper clip, it was difficult to insert sheets of paper into his clip.
column2: 由于它没有成熟回形针所拥有的两个完整环形，因此很难将其插入纸张中。

column1: One could manipulate the end of the inner wire so that it could receive the sheet, but the outer wire was a dead end because it could not exploit the torsion principle.
column2: 人们可以操控内侧钢丝的尾部，使其能够卡在纸上，但外侧钢丝是个死胡同，因为其无法运用扭转原理。

column1: The clip would instead stand out like a keel, perpendicular to the sheet of paper.
column2: 回形针会像船的龙骨一样突出，垂直于纸张。

column1: The impracticality of Vaaler's design may easily be demonstrated by cutting off the last outer loop and one long side from a regular Gem clip.
column2: 从常规的宝石型回形针上切下最后的外侧环形以及一条长边，即可验证瓦勒设计的不实用性。

column1: The originator of the Norwegian paper clip myth was an engineer of the Norwegian national patent agency who visited Germany in the 1920s to register Norwegian patents in that country.
column2: 挪威回形针传说的提出者是一名挪威国家专利局工程师，他在 20 世纪 20 年代到访德国，登记在德国注册的挪威专利。

column1: He came across Vaaler's patent, but failed to detect that it was not the same as the then-common Gem-type clip.
column2: 他发现了瓦勒的专利，但没有认识到它并不是当时常见的宝石型回形针。

column1: In the report of the first fifty years of the patent agency, he wrote an article in which he proclaimed Vaaler to be the inventor of the common paper clip.
column2: 他在专利局的前五十年报告中写了一篇文章，声称瓦勒发明了常见回形针。

column1: This piece of information found its way into some Norwegian encyclopedias after World War II.
column2: 第二次世界大战后，一些挪威百科全书收录了这则信息。

column1: Events of that war contributed greatly to the mythical status of the paper clip.
column2: 那场战争中的事件很大程度上造成了回形针的神秘状态。

column1: Patriots wore them in their lapels as a symbol of resistance to the German occupiers and local Nazi authorities when other signs of resistance, such as flag pins or pins showing the cipher of the exiled King Haakon VII of Norway were forbidden.
column2: 爱国者在翻领上佩戴它们，用来表示对德国占领者和当地纳粹机构的反抗，因为当时禁止使用其他反抗标志，如国旗徽章或表示被驱逐的挪威哈康七世的密码的徽章。

column1: Those wearing them did not yet see them as national symbols, as the myth of their Norwegian origin was not commonly known at the time.
column2: 佩戴者没有认为它们是国家标志，因为当时挪威起源的传说不为人所知。

column1: The clips were meant to denote solidarity and unity ("we are bound together").
column2: 回形针代表着团结统一（“我们紧密相连”）。

column1: The wearing of paper clips was soon prohibited, and people wearing them could risk severe punishment.
column2: 很快就禁止佩戴回形针，佩戴者也可能会面临严厉处罚。

column1: The leading Norwegian encyclopedia mentioned the role of the paper clip as a symbol of resistance in a supplementary volume in 1952, but did not yet proclaim it a Norwegian invention.
column2: 挪威领先百科全书曾在 1952 年的补充卷中提及回形针作为反抗的标志，但没有声称回形针是挪威发明。

column1: That information was added in later editions.
column2: 后来的版本中添加了该信息。

column1: According to the 1974 edition, the idea of using the paper clip to denote resistance originated in France.
column2: 根据 1974 年版，使用回形针表示反抗的想法起源于法国。

column1: A clip worn on a lapel or front pocket could be seen as "deux gaules" (two posts or poles) and be interpreted as a reference to the leader of the French Resistance, General Charles de Gaulle.
column2: 在翻领或胸前口袋上佩戴回形针可以看作“两杠”的标志，可以指代法国抵抗运动的领导者夏尔·戴高乐将军。

column1: The post-war years saw a widespread consolidation of the paper clip as a national symbol.
column2: 战后几年里，回形针被广泛认为是国家象征。

column1: Authors of books and articles on the history of Norwegian technology eagerly seized it to make a thin story more substantial.
column2: 有关挪威科技史的书籍和文章的作者都渴望让这个小故事变得更有依据。

column1: They chose to overlook the fact that Vaaler's clip was not the same as the fully developed Gem-type clip.
column2: 他们选择忽视瓦勒的回形针与成熟的宝石型回形针不一样这一事实。

column1: In 1989 a giant paper clip, almost 7 m (23 ft) high, was erected on the campus of a commercial college near Oslo in honour of Vaaler, ninety years after his invention was patented. But this monument shows a Gem-type clip, not the one patented by Vaaler.
column2: 1989 年，发明获得专利的九十年后，为了纪念瓦勒，在奥斯陆附近的一所商学院的校园里建造了一座几乎 7 米（23 英尺）高的大型回形针雕塑。但这座雕塑是宝石型回形针，并不是瓦勒获得专利的那种。

column1: The celebration of the alleged Norwegian origin of the paper clip culminated in 1999, one hundred years after Vaaler submitted his application for a German patent.
column2: 为回形针起源于挪威这一传说举办的庆祝活动于 1999 年达到高潮，距离瓦勒提交德国专利申请刚好一百年。

column1: A commemorative stamp was issued that year, the first in a series to draw attention to Norwegian inventiveness.
column2: 那年发行了纪念邮票，这是首个引起人们重视挪威创造的系列。

column1: The background shows a facsimile of the German "Patentschrift".
column2: 背景是德国“Patentschrift"的摹本。

column1: However, the figure in the foreground is not the paper clip depicted on that document, but the much better known "Gem".
column2: 但前景中的形象并不是文件记载的回形针，而是更出名的“宝石”型回形针。

column1: In 2005, the national biographical encyclopedia of Norway (Norsk biografisk leksikon) published the biography of Johan Vaaler, stating he was the inventor of the paper clip.
column2: 2005 年，挪威国家传记百科全书发表了约翰·瓦勒的传记，表示他发明了回形针。

column1: Wire is versatile in its nature.
column2: 金属丝用途广泛。

column1: Thus a paper clip is a useful accessory in many kinds of mechanical work including computer work: the metal wire can be unfolded with a little force.
column2: 因此，回形针在包括电脑运作等多种机械运作中都是实用配件：只需一点力就可以展开金属丝。

column1: Several devices call for a very thin rod to push a recessed button which the user might only rarely need.
column2: 有的设备需要使用非常薄的杆按压嵌入式按钮，用户很少需要按压此按钮。

column1: This is seen on most CD-ROM drives as an "emergency eject" should the power fail; also on early floppy disk drives (including the early Macintosh).
column2: 例如，大多数只读光盘驱动器上都有“紧急弹出”，避免突然断电；早期的软盘驱动器（包括早期的 Macintosh）上也有类似设置。

column1: Various smartphones require the use of a long thin object such as a paper clip to eject the SIM card and some Palm PDAs advise the use of a paper clip to reset the device.
column2: 多种智能手机都需要使用回形针等薄的长形物体弹出 SIM 卡，有的 Palm PDA 也建议使用回形针重新设置设备。

column1: The track ball can be removed from early Logitech pointing devices using a paper clip as the key to the bezel.
column2: 可以使用回形针作为外壳的钥匙从早期的罗技定点设备中移除追踪球。

column1: A paper clip bent into a "U" can be used to start an ATX PSU without connecting it to a motherboard (connect the green to a black on the motherboard header).
column2: 将回形针弯成“U”型即可在无需连接至主板（将绿色连接至主板顶部的黑色）的情况下启动 ATX PSU。

column1: One or more paper clips can make a loopback device for a RS232 interface (or indeed many interfaces).
column2: 使用一个或多个回形针即可为 RS232 接口（或其他多种接口）制作回环设备。

column1: A paper clip could be installed in a Commodore 1541 disk-drive as a flexible head-stop.
column2: 可以在 Commodore 1541 软盘驱动器中安装回形针，用于随时停住磁头。

column1: A paper clip can be used (unsafely) to temporarily bridge a blown fuse.
column2: 回形针可用于（不安全地）暂时接上烧断的保险丝。

column1: The steel wire from a paperclip can be used in dentistry to form a dental post.
column2: 牙医可以使用回形针的钢丝来制作牙桩钉。

column1: Paper clips can be bent into a crude but sometimes effective lock picking device.
column2: 回形针可以弯成粗糙但有时很有效的开锁设备。

column1: Some types of handcuffs can be unfastened using paper clips.
column2: 有些类型的手铐可以用回形针打开。

column1: There are two approaches.
column2: 有两种方式。

column1: The first one is to unfold the clip in a line and then twist the end in a right angle, trying to imitate a key and using it to lift the lock fixator.
column2: 第一种是把回形针展开变成直线，然后将尾部扭成适当角度，尝试模仿钥匙并用其抬起锁固定器。

column1: The second approach, which is more feasible but needs some practice, is to use the semi-unfolded clip kink for lifting when the clip is inserted through the hole where the handcuffs are closed.
column2: 第二种方法更加可行但需要练习，具体方法是把半展开的回形针插入锁好的手铐中抬起内部结构。

column1: A paper clip image is the standard image for an attachment in an email client.
column2: 回形针图像是邮件附件中的标准图像。

column1: In 1994, the US imposed anti-dumping tariffs against China, on paper clips.
column2: 1994 年，美国对中国的回形针强制收取反倾销关税。

column1: The Band-Aid was invented in 1920 by a Johnson & Johnson employee, Earle Dickson in Highland Park, New Jersey for his wife Josephine, who frequently cut and burned herself while cooking.
column2: 1920 年，强生公司的一名员工厄尔·迪克森在新泽西州海兰帕克市发明了创可贴，缘由是妻子约瑟芬做饭时经常割伤和烫伤自己。

column1: The prototype allowed her to dress her wounds without assistance.
column2: 这款最初的创可贴可以让她在没有人帮助的情况下包扎伤口。

column1: Dickson passed the idea on to his employer, which went on to produce and market the product as the Band-Aid.
column2: 迪克森把这一思路带到公司，强生公司于是生产了这种产品并以“Band-Aid（创可贴）”的命名进行销售。

column1: Dickson had a successful career at Johnson & Johnson, rising to vice president before his retirement in 1957.
column2: 迪克森在强生的事业很成功，1957 年退休前干到了副总裁的位置。

column1: Perhaps a curiosity, the word "Band" in German means tape.
column2: 怕有人好奇，此处解释一下，“Band”在德语中是“绷带”的意思。

column1: The original Band-Aids were handmade and not very popular.
column2: 最初的创可贴是手工制作的，买的人并不多。

column1: By 1924, Johnson & Johnson introduced machine-made Band-Aids and began the sale of sterilized Band-Aids in 1939.
column2: 到 1924 年，强生公司开始推出机器制作的创可贴； 1939 年，强生开始销售消毒创可贴。

column1: In 1951, the first decorative Band-Aids were introduced.
column2: 1951 年，第一款装饰创可贴面世。

column1: They continue to be a commercial success, with such themes as Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Oliver & Jenny, Superman, Spider-Man, Rocket Power, Rugrats, smiley faces, Barbie, Dora the Explorer, Batman and Duck Dynasty.
column2: 这一类创可贴也在市场上大获成功，有米奇老鼠、唐老鸭、奥利弗和珍妮、超人、蜘蛛侠、火箭动力、淘气小兵兵、笑脸、芭比娃娃、爱探险的朵拉、蝙蝠侠、鸭子王朝等主题。

column1: In World War II, millions were shipped overseas, helping popularize the product.
column2: 二战期间，数以百万的创可贴被运到国外，帮助推广了这一产品。

column1: Since then, Johnson & Johnson currently has estimated a sale of over 100 billion Band-Aids worldwide.
column2: 自那时起，强生迄今在全球销售的创可贴估计已经超过 1000 亿张。

column1: Johnson & Johnson continues to defend the Band-Aid trademark against it being genericized.
column2: 强生公司一直维护 “Band-Aid”这个商标名，反对将其通用化。

column1: Band-Aid arguably has, over time, become a genericized trademark in the United States, and a generic term cannot function as a trademark; but Johnson & Johnson has registered Band-Aid as a trademark on the Principal Register of the United States Patent and Trademark Office, and the registration is valid and legal.
column2: 随着时间的推移，“Band-Aid”可以说已经成为美国的通用商标，而通用名称是不能用作商标的。然而，强生公司已经在美国专利商标局的主薄注册了“Band-Aid”商标，注册是合法有效的。

column1: A registration on the Principal Register does not create ownership rights under the laws of the United States, and a registration may be challenged and removed if the challenger proves as a matter of fact that the alleged trademark has become generic.
column2: 根据美国法律，在主薄上注册并不会产生所有权，如果有人提出要注销某注册商标，并在事实上证明其指称的商标已经成为通用商标，则该注册商标有可能会被注销。

column1: To protect the name, their trademark, Johnson & Johnson always refers to its products as "BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages", not just "Band-Aid".
column2: 为了维护这个品牌名，即他们的商标，强生一直以"BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages"指代这种产品， 而非仅仅叫"Band-Aid"。

column1: The term "weblog" was coined by Jorn Barger on 17 December 1997.
column2: 1997 年 12 月 17 日，约恩·巴格尔创造了“网络博客”一词。

column1: The short form, "blog", was coined by Peter Merholz, who jokingly broke the word weblog into the phrase we blog in the sidebar of his blog Peterme.com in April or May 1999.
column2: “博客”一词的创造者是彼得·默霍尔兹。1999 年 4 月或 5 月时，他开玩笑地将 weblog 一词拆分成短句“we blog in the sidebar of his blog Peterme.com”。

column1: Shortly thereafter, Evan Williams at Pyra Labs used "blog" as both a noun and verb ("to blog", meaning "to edit one's weblog or to post to one's weblog") and devised the term "blogger" in connection with Pyra Labs' Blogger product, leading to the popularization of the terms.
column2: 不久后，Pyra Labs 的埃文·威廉姆斯将“blog”一词作为名词和动词使用（“to blog”意思是“编辑某个人的博客或在某个人的博客上发帖”），并为 Pyra Labs' Blogger 产品设计了“博主”一词，该词迅速流行起来。

column1: Before blogging became popular, digital communities took many forms including Usenet, commercial online services such as GEnie, Byte Information Exchange (BIX) and the early CompuServe, e-mail lists, and Bulletin Board Systems (BBS).
column2: 在博客流行起来之前，数字社区有多种形式，包括 Usenet、如 GEnie、Byte information Exchange (BIX) 和早期的CompuServe 等商业线上服务、邮件列表以及 Bulletin Board Systems (BBS)。

column1: In the 1990s, Internet forum software created running conversations with "threads".
column2: 20 世纪 90 年代，互联网论坛软件使用“线程”创造出持续的对话。

column1: Threads are topical connections between messages on a virtual "corkboard".
column2: 线程是虚拟“软木板”上消息之间的局部连接。

column1: From 14 June 1993, Mosaic Communications Corporation maintained their "What’s New" list of new websites, updated daily and archived monthly.
column2: 1993 年 6 月 14 日起，Mosaic Communications Corporation 每天都会更新新网站的“最新动态”列表，并且每月都会进行存档。

column1: The page was accessible by a special "What's New" button in the Mosaic web browser.
column2: 可以点击 Mosaic 网页浏览器的“最新动态”特殊按钮进入该页面。

column1: The earliest instance of a commercial blog was on the first business to consumer Web site created in 1995 by Ty, Inc., which featured a blog in a section called "Online Diary".
column2: 最早的商业博客是 Ty, Inc. 于 1995 年创建的首个企业对消费者网站，其中“线上日记”部分设有博客。

column1: The entries were maintained by featured Beanie Babies that were voted for monthly by Web site visitors.
column2: 豆豆娃负责维护入口，每月由网站访客选出。

column1: The modern blog evolved from the online diary where people would keep a running account of the events in their personal lives.
column2: 现代博客来源于人们持续记录个人生活中事件的线上日记。

column1: Most such writers called themselves diarists, journalists, or journalers.
column2: 大部分这种作者都称呼自己为日记记录者。

column1: Justin Hall, who began personal blogging in 1994 while a student at Swarthmore College, is generally recognized as one of the earlier bloggers, as is Jerry Pournelle.
column2: 1994 年，贾斯汀·霍尔还是斯沃斯莫尔学院的学生时就开始记录个人博客，他被普遍公认为最早的博主之一，杰里·波内尔也是其中一位。

column1: Dave Winer's Scripting News is also credited with being one of the older and longer running weblogs.
column2: 戴夫·温特尔的 Scripting News 也被认为是更早开始的网络博客之一。

column1: The Australian Netguide magazine maintained the Daily Net News on their web site from 1996.
column2: 从 1996 年起，澳大利亚的 Netguide 杂志会在网站上保持更新每日网络新闻。

column1: Daily Net News ran links and daily reviews of new websites, mostly in Australia.
column2: 每日网络新闻会记录新网站的链接和每日评论，这些网站大多数都在澳大利亚。

column1: Another early blog was Wearable Wireless Webcam, an online shared diary of a person's personal life combining text, digital video, and digital pictures transmitted live from a wearable computer and EyeTap device to a web site in 1994.
column2: 另一个早期博客是 1994 年的 Wearable Wireless Webcam，这是一个线上共享个人生活的日记，形式包括文字以及从可穿戴电脑和 EyeTap 设备实时上传的数字视频和数字照片。

column1: This practice of semi-automated blogging with live video together with text was referred to as sousveillance, and such journals were also used as evidence in legal matters.
column2: 这种结合实时视频和文字的半自动化博客被称为穿戴式监视，这种日记也可作为法律问题中的证据使用。

column1: Some early bloggers, such as The Misanthropic Bitch, who began in 1997, actually referred to their online presence as a zine, before the term blog entered common usage.
column2: 在博客一词普遍使用之前，有些早期的博主，如 1997 年开始的 Misanthropic Bitch，称呼他们在网上发布的内容为电子杂志。

column1: Early blogs were simply manually updated components of common Websites.
column2: 早期的博客只是普通网站上手动更新的内容。

column1: In 1995, the "Online Diary" on the Ty, Inc. Web site was produced and updated manually before any blogging programs were available.
column2: 1995 年，在博客程序出现以前，Ty, Inc. 网站创建了“线上日记”并进行手动更新。

column1: Posts were made to appear in reverse chronological order by manually updating text based HTML code using FTP software in real time several times a day.
column2: 帖子按从新到旧的顺序显示，每天数次实时使用 FTP 软件手动更新 HTML 编码文本。

column1: To users, this offered the appearance of a live diary that contained multiple new entries per day.
column2: 在用户看来，这像每天包含多条新纪录的实时日记。

column1: At the beginning of each new day, new diary entries were manually coded into a new HTML file, and the start of each month, diary entries were archived into its own folder which contained a separate HTML page for every day of the month.
column2: 新的一天开始时，新的日记记录会被手动编码成新的 HTML 文件。每个月开始时，日记记录会存入包含一个月内每一天单独的 HTML 页面的文件夹中。

column1: Then menus that contained links to the most recent diary entry were updated manually throughout the site.
column2: 然后，手动更新网站上包含最新日记记录链接的菜单。

column1: This text-based method of organizing thousands of files served as a springboard to define future blogging styles that were captured by blogging software developed years later.
column2: 这种用文本整理数千份文件的方法为未来的博客提供了跳板，数年后会使用博客软件来管理博客。

column1: The evolution of electronic and software tools to facilitate the production and maintenance of Web articles posted in reverse chronological order made the publishing process feasible to a much larger and less technically-inclined population.
column2: 电子和软件工具的发展可以方便编写和维护按从新到旧顺序发表的网络文章，让更多对技术不太精通的人能够学会发表文章的过程。

column1: Ultimately, this resulted in the distinct class of online publishing that produces blogs we recognize today.
column2: 最终，这产生了独特的线上发表方式，由此出现今天我们认识的博客。

column1: For instance, the use of some sort of browser-based software is now a typical aspect of "blogging".
column2: 例如，使用某些以浏览器为基础的软件就是如今典型的“发博客”。

column1: Blogs can be hosted by dedicated blog hosting services, on regular web hosting services, or run using blog software.
column2: 博客可以由专门的博客主机服务进行托管，在常规网络主机服务上托管，或通过博客软件运行。

column1: An early milestone in the rise in importance of blogs came in 2002, when many bloggers focused on comments by U.S. Senate Majority Leader Trent Lott.
column2: 2002 年是博客重要性崛起的早期里程碑，当时许多博主非常关注美国参议院多数党领导人特伦特·洛特的言论。

column1: Senator Lott, at a party honoring U.S. Senator Strom Thurmond, praised Senator Thurmond by suggesting that the United States would have been better off had Thurmond been elected president.
column2: 隶属纪念美国参议员斯特罗姆·瑟蒙德的党派的参议员洛特赞扬了参议员瑟蒙德，还表示如果以前瑟蒙德能当选总统，美国可能会比现在更好。

column1: Lott's critics saw these comments as a tacit approval of racial segregation, a policy advocated by Thurmond's 1948 presidential campaign.
column2: 洛特的批评家认为这些言论表示对种族隔离的赞同，种族隔离是瑟蒙德在 1948 年总统选举中提出的政策。

column1: This view was reinforced by documents and recorded interviews dug up by bloggers.
column2: 这一观点在博主们挖掘的文件和采访录音中得到证实。

column1: (See Josh Marshall's Talking Points Memo.)
column2: （详见约什·马歇尔谈话要点备忘录。）

column1: Though Lott's comments were made at a public event attended by the media, no major media organizations reported on his controversial comments until after blogs broke the story.
column2: 虽然洛特在众多媒体参加的公共活动中发表这些言论，但直到博主挖掘出这些事情后，媒体才对他的争议性言论进行大肆报道。

column1: Blogging helped to create a political crisis that forced Lott to step down as majority leader.
column2: 博客促发了一场政治危机，迫使洛特辞去多数党领导人一职。

column1: Similarly, blogs were among the driving forces behind the "Rathergate" scandal.
column2: 同样，博客也是“拉瑟门”丑闻背后的推动力之一。

column1: To wit: (television journalist) Dan Rather presented documents (on the CBS show 60 Minutes) that conflicted with accepted accounts of President Bush's military service record.
column2: 即：（电视记者）丹·拉瑟（在 CBS 的《60 分钟》节目中）展示的文件与公认的布什总统服役记录相矛盾。

column1: Bloggers declared the documents to be forgeries and presented evidence and arguments in support of that view.
column2: 博主们声称文件是伪造的，并展示出支持该观点的证据和论据。

column1: Consequently, CBS apologized for what it said were inadequate reporting techniques (see Little Green Footballs).
column2: 因此，CBS 为其所谓的报道技巧不足而道歉（详见 Little Green Footballs）。

column1: Many bloggers view this scandal as the advent of blogs' acceptance by the mass media, both as a news source and opinion and as means of applying political pressure.
column2: 许多博主认为这次的丑闻揭开了媒体接受博客的序幕，博客不仅可以作为新闻的来源和建议，还可以作为施加政治压力的方式。

column1: The impact of these stories gave greater credibility to blogs as a medium of news dissemination.
column2: 这些故事带来的影响让博客成为更可靠的新闻传播媒介。

column1: Though often seen as partisan gossips, bloggers sometimes lead the way in bringing key information to public light, with mainstream media having to follow their lead.
column2: 虽然博客常被视为党派八卦，但有时博主会首先公开关键信息，而主流媒体必须跟随他们的脚步。

column1: More often, however, news blogs tend to react to material already published by the mainstream media.
column2: 但新博客更常对主流媒体已发布的材料作出反应。

column1: Meanwhile, an increasing number of experts blogged, making blogs a source of in-depth analysis.
column2: 同时，越来越多的专家成为博主，博客也因此成为深度分析的来源。

column1: In Russia, some political bloggers have started to challenge the dominance of official, overwhelmingly pro-government media.
column2: 在俄罗斯，有的政治博主开始挑战官方亲政府媒体的领导地位。

column1: Bloggers such as Rustem Adagamov and Alexei Navalny have many followers and the latter's nickname for the ruling United Russia party as the "party of crooks and thieves" has been adopted by anti-regime protesters.
column2: Rustem Adagamov 和阿列克谢·纳瓦利内等博主有许多粉丝，后者还为执政的统一俄罗斯党起了一个别称叫“骗子和小偷的党派”，这个别称被反政府抗议者采用。

column1: This led to the Wall Street Journal calling Navalny "the man Vladimir Putin fears most" in March 2012.
column2: 因此，2012 年 3 月，《华尔街日报》称纳瓦利内是“弗拉基米尔·普京最害怕的男人”。

column1: By 2004, the role of blogs became increasingly mainstream, as political consultants, news services, and candidates began using them as tools for outreach and opinion forming.
column2: 到 2004 年，博客逐渐占据主流地位，政治顾问、新服务和候选人都开始使用博客作为接触群众和形成观点的工具。

column1: Blogging was established by politicians and political candidates to express opinions on war and other issues and cemented blogs' role as a news source.
column2: 政客和政治候选人都开设博客，发表对战争和其他议题的观点，加强了博客作为新闻来源的地位。

column1: (See Howard Dean and Wesley Clark.) Even politicians not actively campaigning, such as the UK's Labour Party's MP Tom Watson, began to blog to bond with constituents.
column2: （详见霍华德·迪安和韦斯利·克拉克。）甚至政客也没那么积极地举办选举活动，例如英国工党国会议员汤姆·沃森开始用博客与选民交流。

column1: In January 2005, Fortune magazine listed eight bloggers whom business people "could not ignore": Peter Rojas, Xeni Jardin, Ben Trott, Mena Trott, Jonathan Schwartz, Jason Goldman, Robert Scoble, and Jason Calacanis.
column2: 2005 年 1 月，《财富》杂志列出了八位商界人士“无法忽视”的博主：彼得·罗哈斯、谢尼·雅尔丹、本·托罗特、梅娜·托罗特、乔纳森·施瓦茨、杰森·戈德曼、罗伯特·斯考伯和杰森·卡拉卡尼斯。

column1: Israel was among the first national governments to set up an official blog.
column2: 以色列是首批设立官方博客的国家政府之一。

column1: Under David Saranga, the Israeli Ministry of Foreign Affairs became active in adopting Web 2.0 initiatives, including an official video blog and a political blog.
column2: 在戴维·萨兰加的带领下，以色列外交部积极接受了网络 2.0 倡议，包括设立官方视频博客和政治博客。

column1: The Foreign Ministry also held a microblogging press conference via Twitter about its war with Hamas, with Saranga answering questions from the public in common text-messaging abbreviations during a live worldwide press conference.
column2: 外交部还通过推特就与哈马斯的战争举办了微博客新闻发布会，萨兰加在全球直播的新闻发布会上用常见的缩写文本回答了公众的问题。

column1: The questions and answers were later posted on IsraelPolitik, the country's official political blog.
column2: 随后在国家官方政治博客 IsraelPolitik 上发布了问题和回答。

column1: The impact of blogging upon the mainstream media has also been acknowledged by governments.
column2: 博客对主流媒体的影响也得到了政府的认可。

column1: In 2009, the presence of the American journalism industry had declined to the point that several newspaper corporations were filing for bankruptcy, resulting in less direct competition between newspapers within the same circulation area.
column2: 2009 年，随着多家报纸公司申请破产，美国新闻业的主导地位逐渐下降，导致同一发行领域的报纸之间的直接竞争减少。

column1: Discussion emerged as to whether the newspaper industry would benefit from a stimulus package by the federal government.
column2: 人们开始讨论联邦政府的刺激政策是否对报纸业有益处。

column1: U.S. President Barack Obama acknowledged the emerging influence of blogging upon society by saying "if the direction of the news is all blogosphere, all opinions, with no serious fact-checking, no serious attempts to put stories in context, then what you will end up getting is people shouting at each other across the void but not a lot of mutual understanding”.
column2: 美国总统贝拉克·奥巴马承认博客对社会日益增长的影响力，他表示“如果新闻的发展方向只是博客空间，只是各种意见，不经过严格的事实查证，不严肃地讲出前因后果，最终只会变成人们互相大喊，而无法互相理解”。

column1: Between 2009 and 2012, an Orwell Prize for blogging was awarded.
column2: 2009 年至 2012 年都为博客颁发了奥威尔奖。

column1: Many bloggers, particularly those engaged in participatory journalism, are amateur journalists, and thus they differentiate themselves from the professional reporters and editors who work in mainstream media organizations.
column2: 许多博主，特别是参与式新闻博主，都是业余记者，因此他们把自己与在主流媒体工作的专业记者和编辑区分开来。

column1: Other bloggers are media professionals who are publishing online, rather than via a TV station or newspaper, either as an add-on to a traditional media presence (e.g., hosting a radio show or writing a column in a paper newspaper), or as their sole journalistic output.
column2: 其他博主是媒体专业人士，他们在网上发布，而不是在电视或报纸上发布内容，这可能是他们对传统媒体（如主持电台节目或在纸质报纸上写专栏）的补充，或是他们唯一输出新闻的地方。

column1: Some institutions and organizations see blogging as a means of "getting around the filter" of media "gatekeepers" and pushing their messages directly to the public.
column2: 有的机构和组织把博客视为“绕开”媒体“守门员”的方式，可以直接向公众推送信息。

column1: Many mainstream journalists, meanwhile, write their own blogs—well over 300, according to CyberJournalist.net's J-blog list.
column2: 同时，许多主流记者都会写自己的博客，根据 CyberJournalist.net 的记者博客名单，数量超过 300 个。

column1: The first known use of a blog on a news site was in August 1998, when Jonathan Dube of The Charlotte Observer published one chronicling Hurricane Bonnie.
column2: 1998 年 8 月，首次在新闻网站上使用博客，当时《夏洛特观察家》的乔纳森·杜比发表了飓风邦尼记录。

column1: Some bloggers have moved over to other media.
column2: 有的博主转移到其他媒体。

column1: The following bloggers (and others) have appeared on radio and television: Duncan Black (known widely by his pseudonym, Atrios), Glenn Reynolds (Instapundit), Markos Moulitsas Zúniga (Daily Kos), Alex Steffen (Worldchanging), Ana Marie Cox (Wonkette), Nate Silver (FiveThirtyEight.com), and Ezra Klein (Ezra Klein blog in The American Prospect, now in the Washington Post).
column2: 以下（及其他）博主出现在电台和电视上：邓肯·布莱克（以笔名阿特里奥斯闻名）、格伦·雷诺兹（Instapundit）、Markos Moulitsas Zúniga（Daily Kos）、亚历克斯·斯特芬（Worldchanging）、安娜·玛丽·考克斯（Wonkette）、纳特·西尔弗（FiveThirtyEight.com）以及 以斯拉·凯恩（以斯拉·凯恩的博客原本在《美国展望》，现在《华盛顿邮报》）。

column1: In counterpoint, Hugh Hewitt exemplifies a mass media personality who has moved in the other direction, adding to his reach in "old media" by being an influential blogger.
column2: 相反，休·休伊特是大众传媒人物代表，他转向另一个方向，通过成为具有影响力的博主，扩大自己在“旧媒体”的影响力。

column1: Similarly, it was Emergency Preparedness and Safety Tips On Air and Online blog articles that captured Surgeon General of the United States Richard Carmona's attention and earned his kudos for the associated broadcasts by talk show host Lisa Tolliver and Westchester Emergency Volunteer Reserves-Medical Reserve Corps Director Marianne Partridge.
column2: 同样地，正是《应急准备》和《在线广播安全建议》等博客文章引起了美国卫生局局长理查德·卡莫纳的注意，并因脱口秀主持人丽莎·托利佛和韦斯特切斯特应急志愿者储备的医疗储备小组组长玛丽安·帕特里奇的相关广播而赢得称赞。

column1: Blogs have also had an influence on minority languages, bringing together scattered speakers and learners; this is particularly so with blogs in Gaelic languages.
column2: 博客也影响了小语种，把分散的讲和学这些语言的人聚集起来；盖尔语博客就是一个突出的例子。

column1: Minority language publishing (which may lack economic feasibility) can find its audience through inexpensive blogging.
column2: 小语种出版业（缺乏经济可行性）可以通过成本低的博客找到其受众。

column1: There are examples of bloggers who have published books based on their blogs, e.g., Salam Pax, Ellen Simonetti, Jessica Cutler, ScrappleFace.
column2: 以下博主都根据他们的博客出版了书籍，例如萨拉姆·帕克斯、艾伦·西蒙尼第、杰西卡·卡特勒、ScrappleFace。

column1: Blog-based books have been given the name blook.
column2: 以博客为基础出版的书籍被称为博客书。

column1: A prize for the best blog-based book was initiated in 2005, the Lulu Blooker Prize.
column2: 最佳博客书奖项始于 2005 年的露露布鲁克奖。

column1: However, success has been elusive offline, with many of these books not selling as well as their blogs.
column2: 但是，许多书并不如博客畅销，在线下难以取得成功。

column1: The book based on Julie Powell's blog "The Julie/Julia Project" was made into the film Julie & Julia, apparently the first to do so.
column2: 以朱莉·鲍威尔的博客“朱莉/朱莉亚项目”为基础的书籍被翻拍成电影《朱莉与朱莉亚》，这是第一本被翻拍的博客书。

column1: Consumer-generated advertising is a relatively new and controversial development, and it has created a new model of marketing communication from businesses to consumers.
column2: 由消费者驱动的广告是相对有争议的新发展，为从企业到消费者的市场营销沟通创造了新的模式。

column1: Among the various forms of advertising on blog, the most controversial are the sponsored posts.
column2: 在各种博客广告模式中，最具争议性的就是赞助帖。

column1: These are blog entries or posts and may be in the form of feedback, reviews, opinion, videos, etc. and usually contain a link back to the desired site using a keyword or several keywords.
column2: 这些博客记录或帖子可能是反馈、评价、意见、视频等形式，通常用一个或多个关键词设置可跳转特定网站的链接。

column1: Blogs have led to some disintermediation and a breakdown of the traditional advertising model, where companies can skip over the advertising agencies (previously the only interface with the customer) and contact the customers directly via social media websites.
column2: 博客带来了一定程度的去中介化，影响了传统广告模式，企业可以跳过广告公司（此前是与消费者交流的唯一途径），通过社交媒体网站直接联系消费者。

column1: On the other hand, new companies specialised in blog advertising have been established, to take advantage of this new development as well.
column2: 另一方面，为了利用这项新发展，也建立了专门制作博客广告的新公司。

column1: However, there are many people who look negatively on this new development.
column2: 但是，还有很多人不看好这项新发展。

column1: Some believe that any form of commercial activity on blogs will destroy the blogosphere’s credibility.
column2: 有的人认为博客上任何形式的贸易活动都会破坏博客圈的公信力。

column1: Blogging can result in a range of legal liabilities and other unforeseen consequences.
column2: 博客可能会导致一系列的法律责任和其他无法预测的后果。

column1: Several cases have been brought before the national courts against bloggers concerning issues of defamation or liability.
column2: 已经有几起针对博主的案件被提交至国家法院，案件涉及诽谤或责任问题。

column1: U.S. payouts related to blogging totaled $17.4 million by 2009; in some cases these have been covered by umbrella insurance.
column2: 到 2009 年，美国有关博客的支出总额达到 1740 万美元；部分情况属于雨伞险的承保范围。

column1: The courts have returned with mixed verdicts.
column2: 法院得出多种裁决。

column1: Internet Service Providers (ISPs), in general, are immune from liability for information that originates with third parties (U.S. Communications Decency Act and the EU Directive 2000/31/EC).
column2: 总的来说，互联网服务提供商无需对第三方提供的信息承担责任（美国通信规范法和欧盟指令 2000/31/EC）。

column1: In Doe v. Cahill, the Delaware Supreme Court held that stringent standards had to be met to unmask the anonymous bloggers, and also took the unusual step of dismissing the libel case itself (as unfounded under American libel law) rather than referring it back to the trial court for reconsideration.
column2: 在多伊起诉卡希尔的案件中，特拉华州最高法院认为揭露匿名博主身份时必须要遵守严格的标准，还采取了非同寻常的措施，驳回诽谤案件（根据美国诽谤法，这是没有根据的），而不是将其发回初审法庭重新审议。

column1: In a bizarre twist, the Cahills were able to obtain the identity of John Doe, who turned out to be the person they suspected: the town's mayor, Councilman Cahill's political rival.
column2: 奇怪的是，卡希尔夫妇获得了约翰·多伊的身份，结果发现正是他们怀疑的人。多伊是该镇的镇长，也是议员卡希尔的政治对手。

column1: The Cahills amended their original complaint, and the mayor settled the case rather than going to trial.
column2: 卡希尔夫妇修改了原来的起诉书，镇长处理了案件，无需提交法院审判。

column1: In January 2007, two prominent Malaysian political bloggers, Jeff Ooi and Ahirudin Attan, were sued by a pro-government newspaper, The New Straits Times Press (Malaysia) Berhad, Kalimullah bin Masheerul Hassan, Hishamuddin bin Aun and Brenden John a/l John Pereira over an alleged defamation.
column2: 2007 年 1 月，两名马来西亚著名政治博主黄泉安和阿希鲁丁·阿丹因涉嫌诽谤被亲政府报纸新海峡时报（马来西亚）有限公司、Kalimullah bin Masheerul Hassan、Hishamuddin bin Aun 和 Brenden John a/l John Pereira 起诉。

column1: The plaintiff was supported by the Malaysian government.
column2: 原告得到马来西亚政府的支持。

column1: Following the suit, the Malaysian government proposed to "register" all bloggers in Malaysia in order to better control parties against their interest.
column2: 诉讼结束后，为了更好地控制各方的利益，马来西亚政府提出要“登记”马来西亚所有博主。

column1: This is the first such legal case against bloggers in the country.
